p: Once the immune system is breached, the virus propagates and reaches the lower respiratory tract and alveoli. Then the virus can penetrate alveoli and reaches systemic circulation causing viremia [ 3]. The virus binds to multiple organs having ACE2 receptor protein. During this stage, cell-mediated immunity becomes robust and starts releasing various pro-inflammatory cytokines (IFN-α, IFN-γ, IL-1B, IL-6, IL-12, IL-18, IL-33, TNF-α, etc.) and chemokines (CCL2, CCL3, CCL5, CXCL8, CXCL9, CXCL10, etc.) causing damage to multiple organs known as Cytokine storm [ 16, 17]. We may need to suppress the inflammation for improvement during this severe stage [ 12]. IL-6 receptor antagonist (Tocilizumab), and anti-inflammatory interleukin (IL-10) are proposed to have a therapeutic role in the reduction of severity and mortality of COVID-19 [ 18, 19]. As increased risk of thromboembolic phenomena is also found to be associated with COVID-19, prophylactic antithrombotic medications are advised during this stage [ 20].
